metadata.Title: CVE-2013-0157 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
(a) mount and (b) umount in util-linux 2.14.1, 2.17.2, and probably otherversions allow local users to determine the existence of restricteddirectories by (1) using the --guess-fstype command-line option or (2)attempting to mount a non-existent device, which generates different errormessages depending on whether the directory exists.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0157` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdextrautils - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
eject - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
fdisk - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
libblkid1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
libfdisk1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
libmount1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
libsmartcols1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
libuuid1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
mount - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
rfkill - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
util-linux - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
util-linux-locales - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
uuid-runtime - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
bsdutils - 1:2.36.1-8ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: util-linux package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.26.2-6ubuntu1').
util-linux package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.26.2-6ubuntu1').
